rooms.Name: Lakefront Museum Entrance
rooms.Description:
As you go up the marble steps, you notice a big, marble, double door.
The architecture seems to be of the Greek type.  On the door you 
notice a sign.

Exits.Description: You see the parking lot, and looking for your car is going to be hard.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Hours:
Monday - Friday 10am to 5pm
Saturday and Sunday 11am to 6pm

rooms.Name: Guard Station
rooms.Description:
Here you see another counter.  This one has a clip-board that the
guards use to sign in on.  As you walk past the counter, the
guard behind it glances up at you.

rooms.Name: Ticket Counter
rooms.Description:
Here you see a counter with maps to the museum.  There is a sign
behind the lady sitting at the counter.  As you walk up to the
counter, the lady smiles at you.

Exits.Description: You see the Entrance to the Museum

ExtraDescs.Description: The price for a ticket is 100 coins.

rooms.Name: Information Desk
rooms.Description:
Here is yet another counter.  The woman behind it looks up from
her paper as you wander by.

Exits.Description: You see the Mummies in that direction

rooms.Name: The Mummies
rooms.Description:
As you look in this part of the museum, you notice people who are
mummified in the cases.  As you look closer, you notice that they
are at least 200 years old.

rooms.Name: Ancient Pottery
rooms.Description:
Within this part of the museum, there is a lot of pottery, most
of it in pieces and all of it is old.  There are different types
and styles of pottery here.  Bowls, plates, mugs, Aztec, Greek, and
Mayan make up a few.

rooms.Name: Art Gallery
rooms.Description:
As you look around this room, the first thing you notice are the paintings on
the walls.  They are done by famous artists like Van Gough and Monnet.  You
stand in awe admiring the beauty of their works.  There is a stairway here that
leads up and down.

Exits.Description: You see the bottom of the stairs

rooms.Name: Rare Gems
rooms.Description:
There are cases lined up against the wall.  Within the cases you
notice many types of jewlery, gems, necklaces, rings and such.
There is a stairway leading down.

rooms.Name: Sculpture Hall
rooms.Description:
Walking around the area you find sculptures of all types, from ancient 
Aztec, to Greek, to modern replicants of other sculptures.  You notice
one ancient Egyptian sculpture of a beautiful woman in an almost
cat-like pose that bears a striking resemblance to ... Cati?  The
sculptures are in varying states of decay, from well preserved 
to crumbling.

rooms.Name: Museum Cafe
rooms.Description:
You see a bunch of tables and chairs.  Near the back is a line where
you can buy hamburgers, pretzels, hotdogs, cookies, and coke.  If you
want to buy something, remember to get in line!

rooms.Name: Bottom of stairs
rooms.Description:
As you climb down the stairs you notice it is not as clean as the
rest of the museum.  Once you get to the bottom of the stairs you 
notice a door to your west.

rooms.Name: Open Room
rooms.Description:
As you walk past the door, you notice that this place is a lot
dirtier than you saw upstairs.  There are boxes stacked neatly
along the south wall.

rooms.Name: Break Room
rooms.Description:
In this room you notice a table and a few vending machines.  At the
table one of the workers watches you as you walk into the room.  The
worker says, "You lost?  Stairs are that way."  He points to the south
west.

rooms.Name: Loading Dock
rooms.Description:
You see a large door where a truck can unload boxes for the museum.
There is a desk there with papers and pens on it.

rooms.Name: Weapons of War
rooms.Description:
Here are all the weapons that were used in different wars, different
time periods, swords, armor, and guns.  As you look about you, you wonder
how they fought like that.

rooms.Name: Lakefront Public School Entrance
rooms.Description:
As you walk up to the one room building, you notice that it looks
like a house.  The door is made of oak and the roof is red.  From the
west, you hear the ringing of a bell.

Exits.Description: You see desks within the school.

rooms.Name: Inside Lakefront School
rooms.Description:
As you walk inside the school, you see about 20 desks.  In the front 
of the room is a bigger desk.  Behind the desk, a lady is holding the
bell that you heard from the entrance.

Exits.Description: You see the door that leads outside.

rooms.Name: Playground
rooms.Description:
As you pass-by, you notice the equipment.  This equipment is for
the children to play on.  As you look about, you notice kids playing
and laughing.

Exits.Description: You see the entrance to the school.

rooms.Name: The Intersection of Pierwalk and Union.
rooms.Description:
This newly paved road continues north and south.  To the east you see
a very large building with two floors.  Union is to your west.

Exits.Description: You see the parking lot.  Finding a parking place is going to be hard.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
This road is paved with black tar, one of the few around here.
Buildings line the west side of the road that do not interest you.
To the east, you see one of the Great Lakes.

rooms.Name: Union
rooms.Description:
Union is not that wide compared to the other streets in Lakefront
City. The street is made of cobblestone.  There are buildings
that do not interest you to the north and south.

Exits.Description: The intersection of Union and Pierwalk Avenue.

rooms.Name: Union
rooms.Description:
This cobblestone street is not that wide.  To the north and to the
south of you are apartments.  As you walk by, you pay little 
attention to them.

rooms.Name: Intersection of Union and Broad
rooms.Description:
Broad goes north and south from here, or you can go east onto Union
to get to the lake.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
The road is one of the few roads that are paved with black tar.
You notice to the west of you, an office of sorts.  To the east,
you notice one of the Great Lakes.

Exits.Description: You see more of Pierwalk Avenue.

rooms.Name: Entrance to John O'Malleys
rooms.Description:
You see a two story building.  It is a well kept brick building with a
few windows.  The door is made of solid wood.  There is a sign on the 
door.

rooms.Name: John O'Malleys Office
rooms.Description:
You are standing a room with two chairs and a desk.  Behind the desk is 
another chair.  On the desk is a phone, address book, calendar, and a 
cup full of pens and pencils.  As you walk into the room, a man looks
up at you.

rooms.Name: Stairway
rooms.Description:
You see a narrow staircase that goes upward.  There is no carpeting.  The
floor looks very dirty.

Exits.Description: You see the top of the stairs.

rooms.Name: Top of Stairs
rooms.Description:
You are at the top of the stairs.  It is not well lit.  To the east there
seems to be a door.

Exits.Description: You see the bottom of the stairs.

rooms.Name: John's Place
rooms.Description:
Within this room, you see a bed, and a small kitchen.  Within the kitchen
part of the room, there is a refrigerator and a stove.  The place smells
like cigarettes and it is not very clean.

rooms.Name: The Parking Lot
rooms.Description:
This is the parking lot for the Museum.  When you park here, don't 
forget to lock your doors.

Exits.Description: You see the Museum.  Wouldn't be a great day to look inside?

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
As you walk, you notice the lake to the east.  To the west, you notice
more stores that do not interest you at all.  The road is made of black
tar, which is rare around here.

Exits.Description: You see more of Pierwalk Avenue.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
To the east is Lake Michigan.  To the west are building that you don't 
know what they are.  The road is of black tar, which is rare.

rooms.Name: Union
rooms.Description:
Your feet start to hurt while walking on the cobblestone.  If you
were to keep going west, you will hit Broad.  If you went east, 
however, you will reach Pierwalk Avenue.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
On this wide street the only thing that is worth noting, is the
Police Station to the west.

Exits.Description: You see the intersection of Union and Broad.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
The road look just like the rest of Broad street except that there
is nothing noteworthy on this section of the street.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
This is a very wide street that should have a lot of noteworthy
buildings off to the side, but the one thing you notice about
this section of the street that there's nothing worthy of
noting except for the bullet riddled model T sitting by the
east side curb of the road.

Exits.Description: You see Broad that leads to Union.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This car looks as if it's been through a war.  Thinking of the
time period though, you figure it probably has.  GANG WAR!  It is
the leading cause of death among automobiles.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description: Broad continues, but there is nothing of noteworthiness here either.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
To the east of you is the sound of laughter.  On this wide street
you wonder why you hear loud laughter so close.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
On this wide street, the only thing that gets your attention is
the sound of laughter to the west of you.

rooms.Name: Martin's Market
rooms.Description:
As you wak into the store, you notice to the right of you is the 
counter. Once you walk fully into the store you see watermellons,
bananas, peanuts, ice and oranges for sale.  There is an elderly
gentleman behind the counter.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
As you look east, you have a good look at the water.  It looks
bright blue and clean.  To the west of you, are warehouses with
people running about.  To the north you see more of Pierwalk Avenue.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
When walking upon this road the only thing that you notice is a
beautiful dome shaped building to the west.  This temple seems
to have only three levels and then the dome at the top.  Columns
are at all of the corners of the temple and pine trees come out
in a straight line from the corners near the door.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
As you look about you, you see water to the east, a large, pointed
building to the southwest and a line of trees to the west coming
from the pointed building.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
Nothing gets your attention as you walk down this street.  It all
looks the same to you.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
As you walk down Pierwalk, you notice to the west of you a dark alley.
To the east of you is the Lake which looks very calm.

rooms.Name: Alley
rooms.Description:
The alley is dark and dank, the musty smell of the air that actually
makes it into the alley makes you want to gag.  Clotheslines run between
the two buildings causing the cloths to block out any light that may
have made it to the ground of the alley.  You're not sure what lies
beyond that next sheet...

ExtraDescs.Description:
You look at the sheet trying to figure out what lies beyond it, but
you can't even see shadows because of how dark it is here.

rooms.Name: Alley
rooms.Description:
The alley seems to close in on you.  You're REALLY happy now that you
aren't claustraphobic, or are you?  Did that wall just move in closer?
No, it must just be your imagination and the low lighting playing
tricks on your mind, causing you to think so.  The clotheslines still
cross the alleyway at such a level that you have to duck to get to
the other side of the laundry airing out to dry.   The air that makes
it into the alley makes you want to gag, the smell of wet clothes
aren't helping your stomach any.  By the way... you SWEAR that
wall just moved.

ExtraDescs.Description: Of course it didn't move, it's just brick.

rooms.Name: Alley
rooms.Description:
The buildings are so close together that the light that does make
it in here, doesn't light it up enough to see.  The air that makes
it past the buildings smells so musty and dry that you want to gag.
The stones of the ground cruble beneath your feet.  Not many people
use this alleyway, you're beginning to wonder why you are.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
The road seems a little less worn here, but not by much.  To the
west you notice normal buildings, nothing that seems noteworthy to
you.  But to the east, you notice an apartment building.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
Broad street is like all the other streets around here.  Well worn
from all the walking, wagons, and vehicles that have found their way
dow this red-brick road.  There's nothing of interest on either side
of this road in this section, though you do notice some apartment
buildings farther south.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
This is a very wide road.  Like most of the other streets, Broad is
laid with reddish-brown bricks.  As you look at the street closer, 
you notice that the bricks are cracked from all of the people who
have traveled on them.  To the east you notice a dark alley, and to 
the west you see a store that catches your eye.

Exits.Description: As you look, you notice a store.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
As you walk down the street you notice to the right of you a boat
that is sailing along the water.  Looking closer at the boat, you
see that it is a simple sailboat.  To the east are more buildings
that look the same to you.

ExtraDescs.Description:
It looks like a simple sailboat.  Nothing more noteworthy about it
than it's actually sailing on the water.

rooms.Name: Pierwalk Avenue
rooms.Description:
On this tar road, you notice to the east of you a parking lot.
To the west of you are buildings that do not interest you at all.

Exits.Description: You see the parking lot and further on you see a beach.

rooms.Name: Lake Michigan Beach Parking Lot
rooms.Description:
You walk onto the pavement and notice the yellow lines dipicting
where cars can park.  The lot is about half full.  To the east
you notice a beach where you could go to get a tan if you wanted
to.

Exits.Description: You notice the sandy beach and Lake Michigan in that direction.
Did you have fun at the beach?  Now you can get back on Pierwalk.

rooms.Name: Lakefront Beach
rooms.Description:
As you start to walk on the beach, you notice the fine sand on your
bare feet.  To the east you see Lake Michigan.  To the north and south
you notice more sandy beach and to the far north you notice a playground
area for kids to play on.

Exits.Description:
As you look north, you see people tanning and the lifeguard on the 
lifeguard chair.
You see the parking lot and Pierwalk Ave in that direction.

rooms.Name: Lakefront Beach
rooms.Description:
You see, on this part of the beach, the lifeguard stand, and people
laying on the beach getting a tan.  Why don't you put down your towel
and get a tan also?  What? Don't have a towel?  Perhaps the beach
store carries them.

Exits.Description: You see the playground where kids play.

rooms.Name: Playground
rooms.Description:
You see a bunch of equipment that children are playing on.  This
includes a swing, teeter-totter, and a spider climber.  If you
wanted to, you could go play on the equipment, but be careful, you
could fall and hurt yourself.

rooms.Name: Lakefront Beach
rooms.Description:
As you walk down the beach, your feet feel warm when you walk bare
footed along the beach.  As you glance to the east, you notice the
waves gently rolling the beachside.  You feel relaxed as you walk
along the lakeside not worrying about anything in particular.

Exits.Description: You see more of the wonderful beach.

rooms.Name: Lakefront Beach Store
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this small building, you smell more of the lake air.
Looking around the building, you notice towels, liquid containers, 
flip-flops, and candy.  The young man behind the counter looks at you
and smiles.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
This is a very wide, reddish-brown brick road.  The street is well-worn
from all the people, vehicles, and carts that travel along here from the
beach to wherever.  You see nothing much of interest here.

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
The reddish-brick road called Broad seems to continue endlessly
through this city by the bay (or at least by the lake).   Cars wizz
past you at an amazing speed of.. 45

rooms.Name: Broad
rooms.Description:
As you walk along Broad street, you notice a larg sign to the north
of you.  You wrinkle up your nose as you smell something horrible, also
from that direction.  You're not sure if you can handle the smell
long enough to find out where it's coming from.

Exits.Description: You see the Trollies coming and going.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Police Station
rooms.Description:
You walk past the two lamp posts which say "police" on them and up to
the large oaken door of this 2 story brown brick buidling.

Exits.Description: You see a cop behind a desk.

rooms.Name: Police Station Lobby
rooms.Description:
As you walk into the Police Station Lobby, you see a female police
officer sitting behind the desk.  Above her head, you notice a sign.
Glancing behind her, you notice the movements of other cops.

Exits.Description: You see the door leading to Broad.
You see the movement of cops.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You look at the desk.  On it sits a phone, paper, pens and a
typewriter.  Were you looking for anything in particular?

rooms.Name: Off Duty Lounge
rooms.Description:
In this room is a round table.  On the table you see brown bags with
food on top.  Around the table you see chairs.  Off to the right you 
see a refrigerator, and a stove.  On the stove you see a tea-kettle.
To the left you cabinets.

Exits.Description: You see the movement of cops.

rooms.Name: The Sergeant's Office
rooms.Description:
Here is where the Sergeant of the First Ward works.  There is a desk,
which is full of piles, a phone, pencils, and food.  Behind him is a 
bookcase full of books.  There is a plant to your left.

rooms.Name: The Main Office
rooms.Description:
As you look about, you see many desks lined up in rows.  Behind most
of the desks are police officers who are working.  Other cops are 
moving about from one desk to another.  To the left of you is a door
and to the right is a lounge.

Exits.Description: You see the lounge where there are cops talking.
You see the Information Desk there.
You see a gate to the hallway.

rooms.Name: A Hallway
rooms.Description:
The hallway floor is made out of stone, the walls are cement.  To the
right and left of you are cells.  The hallway is fairly clean, but you
still think something died in here from the smell.

rooms.Name: Jail Cell
rooms.Description:
The jail has a bed on the right.  It has a sink and a toilet on the
left side of the cell.  The bed is a cot and has ragged sheets on 
them. The floor is paved and there is not much light in this cell.

Exits.Description: You see the hallway to freedom!

rooms.Name: Jail Cell
rooms.Description:
On the right is a sink and a toilet.  To the left is a cot with ragged
sheets on it.  The floor is paved and you are having a hard time seeing
the details of the room.

Exits.Description: You see the way to freedom!

rooms.Name: Entrance to the Apartments
rooms.Description:
To your left are mailboxes for the various people that live here.  There
is an apartment to your north and one to your south.  There is also a 
flight of stairs heading upstairs to more apartments.

rooms.Name: Apartment #1
rooms.Description:
In the back of the apartment is a kitchen.  Within the kitchen is a
small table.  You see a couch to the right of you.  To the left of
you is a bed.

rooms.Name: Apartment #2
rooms.Description:
This apartment is a small room.  In the room you see a kitchen of
sorts in the back, a bed to the right and a couch to the left.
Before the kitchen is a table.

rooms.Name: Upper Landing
rooms.Description:
You end up at the upper landing.  There is an apartment to the north and
one to the south.

rooms.Name: Apartment #3
rooms.Description:
In the back of the apartment is a kitchen.  There is a table in the 
kitchen. To the right of you is a nice made bed.  To the left of you
is a couch and a desk and a chair at the desk.

rooms.Name: Apartment #4
rooms.Description:
As you step into this apartment, you notice it is different than 
the rest of them.  There is a kitchen and a table in the back.  The bed
is to the right.  To the left you see a couch and a wine cabnet.  You
think you counted about 20 bottles of wine.

rooms.Name: The Entrance
rooms.Description:
In front of you there is a door.  The door is made of wood.  You see
a peephole in the middle of the door.

rooms.Name: Bahai Temple
rooms.Description:
Within this temple, there are wooden benches to the right and left
of you.  Sitting on the altar in front of you, is a copy of the 
Holy Bible.  Standing beside the altar is the holy water for baptism.
You glance at the beautiful, stained glass windows and get a
sense of peace from the room.

rooms.Name: The Study
rooms.Description:
In the study there is a oak desk.  On the desk there a papers, a phone,
and pens and pencils in a cup.  Behind the desk is an office chair.
To the right is a bookcase full of book.

rooms.Name: The Living Room
rooms.Description:
Here in the living room, there are a couple of couches.  There is 
an end table at each couch.  There is a radio at the far end of the room.
You hear laughter coming to the right of you.  To the right of you,
however, it is dead quiet.

rooms.Name: The Bedroom
rooms.Description:
As you enter this room, you notice a bed in the middle of the back wall.
To the right is the bathroom.  As you look upon the bed, you notice
two people in the bed.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Lakefront Zoo
rooms.Description:
This is the entrance to the zoo.  There is a large sign above you.
You notice as you walk through, there is a gate here also.

Exits.Description: Thru the gate, you see more of the zoo.

ExtraDescs.Description:
As you look at the sign, you notice it arches over the
road. The sign says, LAKEFRONT CITY ZOO.

rooms.Name: Zoo Walkway
rooms.Description:
As you walk on the dirt path, you notice all the animals.  Sniffing
the air, you notice the unpleasant smell of the animals.  To the
northwest, you see the wolves den.  To the northeast, are the
porcupines.

Exits.Description: You see the entrance to the zoo.

rooms.Name: Zoo Walkway
rooms.Description:
As you look on the dirt path, you see pieces of trash laying about.
To the north of you, you see lots of birds.  The path bends to the
northeast and to the northwest creating a fork in the path.

rooms.Name: Zoo Walkway
rooms.Description:
As you look about, you see that the path goes on the the northwest.
To the east, you see an animal with two horns on its head.

rooms.Name: Zoo Walkway
rooms.Description:
This is the end of the walkway.  As you look about, you see more 
animals. To the west, you see an animal with a long nose.  To the
northwest, is an animal with no feet.  To the northeast are animals
that look like housecats, but bigger.

Exits.Description: As you look, you see a lot of snakes.

rooms.Name: Zoo Walkway
rooms.Description:
The path continues to the northeast.  To the east you notice animals
that have hooves for feet.

rooms.Name: Zoo Walkway
rooms.Description:
The path ends here.  As you look about, some of the animals catch your
eye. To the east are ones that look almost human.  To the north are
big furry creatures that you shouldn't mess with.  As you look to the
northeast, you notice that the animal does not move (or al least you
haven't noticed it move).

rooms.Name: Snake Pit
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this cage, you notice all of the snakes.  They range
from 5 feet long to 10 feet long.  I wouldn't get them mad, they might
strangle you!

rooms.Name: The Sloth Cage
rooms.Description:
Within this cage is an animal that is hanging in a tree.  As you look
at it for about five minutes, it still hasn't moved.  While watching 
it you start to get bored.

rooms.Name: Wolves Den
rooms.Description:
This cage looks like a field with a cave.  As you look about in this 
area, you notice the dog like animals here.  The one thing that baffles
you is that they are bigger than normal dogs.

rooms.Name: The Rhinoceros Cage
rooms.Description:
The cage is a concrete slab with a pool in it.  There is a place to
feed the large animal here.

rooms.Name: The Elephant Cage
rooms.Description:
Here are some trees and a pool.  As you look down, you see some grass
and some concrete slab.  As you look at the beasts here, you think
to yourself, maybe I should leave them alone....

rooms.Name: The Great Cats
rooms.Description:
You see a pool and a grassy field.  There is a cave that some of
the cats walk in and out of.  You might have made a mistake entering
their lair.

rooms.Name: The Bird Sanctuary
rooms.Description:
Here are many trees.  As you look about in the trees, you see many
different kinds of birds.  You hear them all chirping as you walk
into this place.

rooms.Name: The Bear's Cave
rooms.Description:
Walking into this cave, you see a couple types of bears.  They seem 
not to like that you walked into thier home.  Better get out quick!

rooms.Name: The Monkey Cage
rooms.Description:
Looking about here, you see animals that look like humans.  They are
all playing in the trees.  They make grunting noises that the others
seem to understand each other.

rooms.Name: The Hooved Animals
rooms.Description:
In the field you see a couple of animal.  One is eating from the 
treetops. The other is eating the grass.  They don't seem to notice
you walk into their home.

rooms.Name: The Porcupines
rooms.Description:
You look about and there isn't that much here except the small 
animals walking around.

rooms.Name: Trolley Station
rooms.Description:
A rather diry train/trolley station sits here.  It is hushed with the
expectancy of the next train arriving.  There is a sign mounted here.

ExtraDescs.Description: The price for a ticket is 100 coins.
